Subject: Housing and Accommodation challenges for CISF personnel
deployed at Airports

Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) is entrusted with the critical
responsibility for providing security to 68 Airports across India. As the first
responders during any contingency, the timely availability of CISF personnel is
paramount.

02. Currently, a significant challenge faced by CISF personnel is the lack of
adequate family accommodations at most of the airports (Details enclosed as
Appendix-A). Rule 61 of the Central Industrial Security Force Rules, 2001 mandates
airport operators to provide 100% accommodation to all supervisory officers (GOs)
and 45% family accommodation to other force personnel deployed at the
respective Airports. Whereas, the housing satisfaction of the CISF posted at various
airports remains merely 12% of the Authorized Quarters. Hence, the current state
of affairs falls short of this requirement. The issue was also deliberated during the
meeting held under the chairpersonship of Hon'ble Union Home Minister and it was
deliberated to provide land to the CISF near the airports (Copy enclosed as
Appendix-B)

03. It is pertinent to mention that the airport operators (JVs / AAI) are providing
eligible HRA to ASG personnel (as per entitlement) in cases where housing dwelling
units have not been allocated. However, due to the high cost of living near airports,
the rent for accommodation significantly exceeds the HRA provided to CISF ASG
personnel.

04. The absence of suitable on-site accommodations poses numerous challenges
before CISF personnel as enumerated below: -

Personnel are compelled to hire residential quarters at considerable
distances from airports, often in scattered locations which make
security personnel vulnerable to insider threat.

ji. | Market rental rates are not compatible with the amount granted to
authorized ASG personnel as HRA. Out-of-station living arrangements,
often with exorbitant rents and security deposits, impose significant
financial strain on personnel.

iii. | Segregated residential locations hinder the implementation of
regimental activities.

iv. Family members face difficulties in fulfilling basic requirements such as
healthcare, schooling, and access to shopping complexes.

05. In view of the above, it is requested to expedite the construction of adequate
family accommodation as per authorization at all airports to mitigate above issues.
These accommodations should be located within the airport campus or in close
proximity, ensuring easy access and rapid response. By providing appropriate
accommodations; we can significantly boost the operational efficiency, morale, and
well-being of CISF personnel, ultimately reinforcing the security framework of our
nation's airports.

06. An urgent initiative and prompt action in the matter would be highly

appreciated.
